instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Screen Turns Off When Lid is Open
threads.message:
Hi everyone.
A customer brought me a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> macbook pro with a screen problem. We found out that LVDS cable needs to be replaced and done it. But now the screen goes off when we open the lid and it turns on and stays on when we close the lid.
I have searched on internet and found too many articles and videos about flexgate off 2016 Macbooks but nothing about <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>.
So definetly need some help to find out where to look or check.

Thank You.

-Emre

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Screen Turns Off When Lid is Open
threads.message:
Check if LCD image stays on disconnecting BIL (J6955).
Then check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal, w/ and w/o BIL connected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Screen Turns Off When Lid is Open
threads.message:
Check if LCD image stays on disconnecting BIL (J6955). = No it goes again.
We have checked the <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal with BIL connected and we measured 3.4V, and without BIL it gives 0.003V (around) (I have checked <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal without screen connected)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Screen Turns Off When Lid is Open
threads.message:
The pull-up resistor for <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is on the MLB (<RESISTOR>R5071</RESISTOR>).
You MUST get 3V, when BIL is disconnected.
If not, remove <CAPACITOR>C6951</CAPACITOR>/55 and check again.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Screen Turns Off When Lid is Open
threads.message:
We get 3V w/ and w/o BIL connected from <RESISTOR>R5071</RESISTOR>. But please correct me if I am wrong do we need to measure these voltages when screen connected or not? I do really not have any knowledge about this. So please bear with me while answering my questions as I can be called as a newbie in this repairing motherboards of macbooks. But I promise you to get all you tell me and will never ask the same things again :)

Thank you

-Emre

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Screen Turns Off When Lid is Open
threads.message:
No matters if LCD present, or not; <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> must be high.
In previous post you've said not present without BIL (0.003V).

Connect back BIL and post <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> level when lid is open/closed.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Screen Turns Off When Lid is Open
threads.message: I have connected the screen and BIL and when the lid is closed I get ~0.003V from the second leg of <RESISTOR>R6961</RESISTOR> which is on <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>. And when I open the lid I get 3.4V from the same leg.
